channel.title: PI deleting walls (object help)

item.title: PI deleting walls (object help)
item.dc:creator: @ravens ravens
item.description:
@ravens wrote:

[code]if (o.getObjectX() > #### && o.getObjectX() < #### && o.getObjectY() > #### && o.getObjectY() < ####){
Objects deleteObject = objectExists(o.getObjectX(), o.getObjectY(), o.getObjectHeight());
removeObject(deleteObject);
removeObject(o);

}[/code]

i wrote this under process(){ in objecthandler.java (obviously with real intergers not “####” )however it does not work, it returns no errors or anything bad it just does not change the server. basically i want this code to delete all the object in the area greater than #### and less than ### , x and y coords
i want to use this to delete walls that are not on a specific tile. if you know an easier method for that please share it too ;D

also, does anyone know how to change the color/texture of trees and water in hybridpvp client?

edit i also tried using this in objectmanager.java, same thing (although i believe it increased my cpu usage? my computers fan was going nuts anyways :eek:)

if (o.objectX > 1 && o.objectX < 9999 && o.objectY > 1 && o.objectY < 9999 && o.objectId > 0){ //Objects deleteObject = objectExists(o.getObjectX(), o.getObjectY(), o.getObjectHeight()); //removeObject(deleteObject); //removeObject(o); objects.remove(o); }

Read full topic
